content.question: An object of mass <math alttext="m equals 3.0 kilograms" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>m</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>3.0</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi>kg</mi></math> is attached to one end of a string with negligible mass and length <math alttext="L equals 0.80 meter" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>L</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0.80</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi></math>. The object is released from rest at time <math alttext="lowercase t equals 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math>, when the string is horizontal. At time <math alttext="lowercase t equals lowercase t sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math> the object is at the location shown in the figure, where the string is vertical. Which of the following is most nearly the magnitude of the tension in the string at time <math alttext="lowercase t equals lowercase t sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>?

choices.label: <math alttext="4 newtons" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>4</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">N</mi></math>
<math alttext="30 newtons" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>30</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">N</mi></math>
<math alttext="60 newtons" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>60</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">N</mi></math>
<math alttext="90 newtons" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>90</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">N</mi></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="90 newtons" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>90</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">N</mi></math>

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
